basics.name: Tom Han Chongye
basics.label: Research Assistant at Salk Institute
basics.summary: Recent Bowdoin graduate in Biology and Computer Science. I'm a research assistant at the Pereira Lab in Salk Institute working on projects that leverages deep learning powered tools to analyze pathogenesis of ALS in mouse model with Dr. Talmo Pereira and Dr. Eiman Azim. When I'm not in lab, you'll find me exploring scenic bike routes around La Jolla or tinkering with my Flipper Zero.

education.area: Molecular and Cellular Biology, Computer Science
courses: CSCI 3485 - Deep Learning for Computer Vision
BIOL 3333 - Advanced Molecular and Cellular Biology

work.summary: Joint position in Dr. Talmo Pereira and Dr. Eiman Azim's labs in the ALS phenotyping group.
Honors Student for Dr. Hadley Horch
highlights: Created a novel analysis pipeline for flight behavior in G. bimaculatus from data collection to analysis report.
Conducted full time original research to understand the basis of adaptive behaviors and plasticity in adult crickets.
Processed over 100+ GB of high throughput pose estimation data, reduced analysis runtime by 50%
